The Director, ESG is a key member of the global ESG team, leading global alignment across all markets related to ESG communications and reporting. This individual resides on the global ESG team and collaborates cross functionally with many different departments within the company. In addition, the Director advises on and leads global reporting activities including the publication of an annual ESG report and third-party questionnaire submissions. The Director manages and provide support to the ESG team.

Lead the development and execution of the annual ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) Report, including defining report strategy and project management from start to finish. nder the supervision of the Director of Supply Chain Optimization, are responsible for delivering best-in-class healthcare solutions that meet our customersâ needs. Provide guidance and specialized expertise to business partners and analysts in the department.
Drive continuous improvement by creating new analysis, innovating on current metrics and reporting.
Post month-end journal entries on ad-hoc basis.
At least 3 years of financial planning, reporting and analysis experience.
Advanced level skill in Microsoft Excel and Powerpoint (e.g. index/match, lookups, pivot tables, sumifs).
SQL/Tableau/Alteryx or other big data analytics tools is a plus.
Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting or related field.

Director, Product Management - Advanced Wound Care

Medline Industries has an immediate opening for a Director of Product Management in our Advanced Wound Care product division! This position will be based out of our Northfield, IL headquarters and will offer a hybrid model of work. The Director of Product Management will oversee and manage Product Teams for the Advanced Wound Care Division. These teams will include Senior Manager and Manager level direct reports. The Director of Product Management will lead the Product Teams in the sourcing, marketing, product development, sales support and financial growth of multiple product categories. This person will also provide subject matter expertise for complex, large divisional product lines, or multiple product categories.

Negotiate pricing with vendors for raw materials and finished goods. Visit vendors to develop products and train personnel in all aspects of each product and usages. Coordinate materials with vendors and develop finished custom items.
Develop and implement comprehensive marketing plans and promotional programs for existing products to include product strategy development, pricing strategy, collateral creation and brand management.

Review monthly financial performance and determine contributing factors. Offer solutions for detrimental sales or cost trends. Prepare product forecasts to include revenue and expense expectations. Analyze sales trends over time and impact of competitive strategies. Support forecasts and budgets with appropriately detailed marketing plans.

Work with Product Teams, Manufacturing, Purchasing, and Engineering to reduce Cost of Goods by assessing packaging, alternate materials, new sources of material, stocking, make to order, direct to customer shipments, etc. Manage inventory by focusing on eliminating surplus and optimizing SKU count.
Develop and deliver training materials for internal stakeholders, sales forces and customers. Create sales tools.
Conduct effective market research and translate that research into new products, product improvements, or line extensions by providing leadership to a multi-functional team.
Travel with sales force to support efforts to convert customers to purchase Medline products. Provide timely follow up to sales forces by answering product questions via e-mail and phone.
Oversee the Skin Health Digital platform and NE1 Wound Management digital tool.
Typically, manages through multiple Managers. Provides leadership and management to one or more major departments of an operating unit or to a department that has system-wide accountability.
Strategic, tactical and operational planning (1yr to 3yr horizon) for the function or department.
Direct budgetary responsibility for one or more departments, functions or major projects/programs.
Interpret and execute policies for departments/projects.
Recommend and implement new policies or modifications to existing policies.

Hiring staff, recommending pay increases, performing performance reviews, training and development of staff, estimating personnel needs, assigning work, meeting completion dates, interpreting and ensuring consistent application of organizational policies.
At least 7 years of marketing, sales, product management or clinical practice experience (preferably in the healthcare industry).
Experience negotiating with outside vendors, including negotiating contracts, prices, resolving service issues and reconciling differences.
At least 4 years of experience managing people, including hiring, developing, motivating and directing people as they work.
Willing to travel up to 35% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state).
Intermediate level skill in Microsoft Word (for example: inserting headers, page breaks, page numbers and tables and/or adjusting table columns).

Intermediate level skill in Microsoft PowerPoint (for example: applying a theme, formatting character spacing, inserting a picture, changing slide layout and theme colors, adding transitions, customizing slide numbers, changing chart style and/or formatting font).

Intermediate level skill in Microsoft Excel (for example: using SUM function, setting borders, setting column width, inserting charts, using text wrap, sorting, setting headers and footers and/or print scaling).

The position will be responsible for managing CRM applications used at Medline. This will include development, integration, implementation, upgrades, support, and maintenance. Stakeholder management, application availability, system and people performance will be part of the critical responsibilities. The ideal candidate should be technically proficient, have exceptional leadership skills, and a keen understanding of using CRM to help deliver efficiency, automation, and productivity gains for the Sales organization.
Provide leadership and direction to direct / indirect reports across multiple business applications.
Set clear goals and expectations for the team.
Coach, mentor, and develop team members, enabling their professional growth.
Oversee the planning, deployment, development, configuration, testing, and ongoing maintenance of CRM applications.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define product roadmaps, requirements, priorities, and build consensus.
Establish and enforce application governance practices, including change management, release management, and documentation.
Take proactive measures to optimize performance and minimize downtime.
Manage relationships with application vendors, including contract negotiations, service level agreements, and performance evaluations.
IT and other business units, to facilitate effective communication and understanding.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their application needs and align IT strategies with business objectives.
Identify opportunities to enhance existing applications or introduce new technologies to drive business efficiency and innovation.
Stay updated with industry trends in the CRM space.
Collaborate with the IT leadership team to define and execute the IT roadmap.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the team, encouraging innovative ideas and process enhancements.
Preferred - Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field, or equivalent in training and experience.
At least 3 years in a leadership/supervisory role
At least 5 years of overall IT delivery experience
Demonstrated experience leading large enterprise projects.
Must have some form of people/performance management experience.
Experience managing any enterprise grade CRM systems (Dynamics 365, Salesforce, etc.)
Experience with analytical tools like Power BI or Tableau
Good grasp of SaaS, Web-based application deployment and integration architectures.
Knowledge of industry best practices of technology design and management
Experience with enterprise application governance aspects like IT security, compliance, disaster recovery policies, etc.
Demonstrated ability to build partnerships with business, technical, governance, and other teams.
Able to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple application teams.
Responsive, organized, and able to multi-task well.
Experience with any major cloud platform (Azure preferred)
Experience with Microsoft Power Platform (power apps, power automate, power pages, etc.)
Business domain knowledge: Sales, B2B Marketing, Customer Service, Order to Cash processes.

Medline Industries is the largest privately held manufacturer and distributor of healthcare supplies in the United States, providing more than 550,000 products that serve the entire continuum of care. Our innovative products and programs can be found in most hospitals, extended-care facilities, surgery centers, physician offices, home care dealers, home health agencies and retail outlets.

Founded in 1910, Medline has grown from a small manufacturer of aprons, surgical gowns and uniforms to a thriving $17 billion global enterprise because of our dedicated people, entrepreneurial spirit and honest values.

Again named one of the countryâs ""Best and Brightest Companies to Work Forâ and once again named to Chicago Tribuneâs Top Workplaces, Medline has experienced fifty-plus years of consecutive annual growth, and is headquartered in Northfield, IL.

Sr. Manager, Business Planning and Analytics

Lead and manage the Business Analytics Team that provides financial and operational decision support to division Sales Operations and Marketing via dashboards, financial modeling, data analysis, and reporting relating to revenue, gross profit, pricing, product costing, quotations, bids, product revisions, market insights, and marketing initiatives. Develop and implement strategies and solutions to improve the data-driven decision-making capabilities of Medlineâs largest product division. Create value by extracting meaningful insights from internal and external data relevant to market share and gross margin improvement.
Identify project opportunities, manage the teamâs project portfolio, and prioritize work to maximize value generation and performance toward division and department objectives.
Responsible for the development and management of actionable data and analytics that improve divisional and sales decision making.

Ensure timely and accurate reporting whether recurring or in response to ad hoc information requests. Understand the underlying business processes, technologies, and applications used to generate transactional and master data, as well as relevant third-party or external data sources.

Collaborate with division leaders to define success metrics, understand relevant goals, and develop measurement solutions as they relate to division analytics. Work with corporate and division IT and BI professionals to vet tools, data sources, standards, and methods.

Coach, mentor, and train a team of business intelligence and operations analysts to establish necessary subject matter expertise and a consistent level of quality, accuracy, and accountability. Set team goals, and conduct performance reviews. Recruit, hire, and develop talent with a balanced approach to technical skills and business acumen.
Oversee major projects, present critical analyses to senior management, and recommend business strategies that drive profitable revenue growth.
Leverage offshore resource teams to expand and enrich capabilities and productivity.
Bachelorâs degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Marketing, Data Science, Computer Science, or similar field.
Experience leading individuals with advanced technical and analytical skillsets, including hiring and talent planning.
7+ years of work experience in analytical roles with a focus on problem solving with data.
4+ years of experience generating standard and ad hoc analyses, dashboards, visualizations, financial models, etc.
Demonstrated capacity to work in a fast-paced environment.
Sound business acumen and comfort with financial terminology and performance metrics.
Strong problem-solving and data analysis skills

Medline Industries, LP, and its subsidiaries, offer a competitive total rewards package, continuing education and training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization. The anticipated salary range for this position is minimum of $120,000.00-$130,000.00 annually. This salary range is an estimate and the actual salary will vary based on applicant's location, education, experience, skills and abilities. This role is bonus and/or incentive eligible.
